summary: Email chain between FBI agents and Gloria Allred's law office regarding travel arrangements for a client, Alicia Arden (Velgos), and her boyfriend to attend a DOJ meeting in Miami for Epstein victims. The emails discuss coordination for the meeting and confirm receipt of invitations.

persons.name: Diane Aldrich
persons.context: Executive assistant at Allred Maroko Goldberg law firm coordinating travel arrangements for a client to attend a DOJ meeting in Miami.

persons.name: Angela Jackson
persons.context: FBI agent based in New York coordinating with Gloria Allred's office regarding DOJ invites and travel arrangements for Epstein victims to a meeting in Miami.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: High-profile attorney whose law firm represents clients who are Epstein victims, involved in coordinating their attendance at a DOJ meeting.

persons.name: Amanda N. Young
persons.context: FBI agent copied on emails regarding DOJ invites and coordination for Epstein victims meeting.

persons.name: Alicia Arden (Velgos)
persons.context: Client of Gloria Allred who is an Epstein victim seeking to attend a DOJ meeting in Miami with her boyfriend for support.

persons.name: Robert Maltbie
persons.context: Boyfriend of Alicia Arden who would accompany her to the Miami DOJ meeting for support.

connections.description: Allred's law firm represents Arden, an Epstein victim, and is coordinating her attendance at a DOJ meeting.
Aldrich is the executive assistant to attorney Gloria Allred at Allred Maroko Goldberg.
FBI agent Jackson coordinates with Allred's assistant Aldrich regarding DOJ meeting arrangements for Epstein victims.
Maltbie is Arden's boyfriend who would accompany her to the Miami DOJ meeting for support.
Both are FBI agents working together on coordinating Epstein victim matters with the DOJ.

events.title: DOJ Miami Meeting for Epstein Victims
events.description: A meeting organized by the Department of Justice in Miami for Epstein victims, with travel arrangements being coordinated by the FBI and victims' attorneys.

events.title: Travel Coordination for Miami Meeting
events.description: Email exchange regarding travel arrangements for Alicia Arden to attend the DOJ meeting in Miami, including her request to bring her boyfriend for support.

locations: 6300 Wilshire Boulevard, Suite 1500, Los Angeles, CA 90048
keyFacts: The Department of Justice organized a meeting in Miami for Epstein victims in October 2020.
Gloria Allred's law firm represents Epstein victims, including client Alicia Arden (Velgos), who sought to attend the DOJ meeting.
FBI agents Angela Jackson and Amanda N. Young were involved in coordinating invitations and travel arrangements for victims to attend the DOJ meeting.
Alicia Arden requested to bring her boyfriend, Robert Maltbie, to the Miami meeting for support.
The email chain shows ongoing coordination between the FBI and victims' attorneys regarding Epstein-related matters.
